intro: Microgonium cultratum, commonly known as the cut-leaf microgonium, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, ribbon-like leaves that are often ribbon-like in appearance. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually submerged. Microgonium cultratum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to water quality through oxygenation.
